# PTD Today Weekly Intelligence Brief  
**Date Range:** Last 7 days (up to 2026-01-01)  

---

## 1) Top Themes  
- Offshore wind turbine capacity growth and ownership changes  
- Solar market expansion globally including UK, US, India, Bangladesh, Nepal  
- Integration of AI and digital twin technology in renewable energy applications  
- Battery storage regulations emphasizing domestic content in India  
- Grid modernization efforts for community solar and efficiency  
- Private equity involvement in renewables ownership  

---

## 2) Top Stories  
- China leads in offshore wind single-unit turbine capacity with Vestas installing a 15 MW turbine at offshore wind farms (Source: offshorewind.biz)  
- UK is on track for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployment in solar projects in 2026 (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Chinese solar manufacturer Eging may exit a flagship photovoltaic project, highlighting challenges in China’s solar manufacturing sector (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- US solar capacity expected to reach 737.8 GW by 2035, signaling robust long-term market growth (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Nepal issues tender for rural solar home system monitoring, pushing off-grid solar deployment (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- A new digital twin using AI has been developed for floating photovoltaic applications, enhancing renewable energy project monitoring (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Bangladesh is seeking contractors for a 220 MW solar project, expanding regional solar infrastructure (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Apollo becomes co-owner of Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, indicating increased private investment in offshore wind (Source: offshorewind.biz)  
- India’s Waaree Energies surpasses 20 GW as the country’s largest ALMM-approved solar manufacturer (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- India mandates a minimum of 20% domestic content in battery storage projects, supporting local manufacturing and supply chain development (Source: pv-magazine.com)  

---

## 3) Sector Takeaways  

**Grid / Substations / HVDC**  
- US state orders utility to enable flexible grid connections for community solar, advancing distributed energy integration (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Utilities risk penalizing efficiency by shifting to fixed charges, an issue requiring regulatory attention to maintain grid efficiency incentives (Source: pv-magazine.com)  

**Renewables**  
- Offshore wind offshore capacity led by China with new high-capacity turbines deployed; new ownership structures with Apollo co-owning major projects.  
- Solar markets show global momentum: UK records, US long-term capacity growth targets, and development tenders in Nepal and Bangladesh.  
- Innovation via digital twins using AI enhances floating PV system operation and monitoring.  
- Indian renewable manufacturing scales up with Waaree Energies and domestic content rules for battery storage reinforcing local supply chains.  

**Oil & Gas**  
- Not enough information in the headline.  

**Data Centers & AI**  
- AI “inference economics” is a major trend to watch in 2026, with AI trading outlooks suggesting continued market relevance (Source: CNBC Television).  

**Chips & Supply Chain**  
- Indian battery storage mandating domestic content hints at upcoming shifts in supply strategy for storage-related semiconductor and component demand (Source: pv-magazine.com).  

**Critical Minerals / Rare Earths**  
- Not enough information in the headline.  

---

## 4) Notable Companies / Regions Mentioned  
- **China:** Offshore wind capacity lead; challenges for solar manufacturer Eging  
- **UK:** Solar CfD market growth  
- **US:** Large solar market expansion; grid flexibility orders  
- **India:** Waaree Energies (largest ALMM-approved solar maker), domestic content mandate for batteries, Tata Power Renewable 1GW PV project  
- **Bangladesh & Nepal:** Solar project tenders and implementations  
- **Apollo:** Co-ownership of Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm  
- **Vestas:** 15 MW offshore wind turbine deployment
